intro: Landolphia leonensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a distinctive, fleshy fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Landolphia leonensis is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in partial shade.
